div.head: CHAP. CXX.
1 Dauid prayeth against Doeg, 3 reproueth his tongue, 5 complaineth of his necessary conuersation with the wicked.
div.ab: [A song of degrees.] In my distresse I cried vnto the Lord: and hee heard me.
Deliuer my soule, O Lord, from lying lips: and from a deceitfull tongue.
What shall be giuen vnto thee? or what shalbe done vnto thee, thou false tongue? Or, what shall the deceitfull tongue giue vnto thee? or what shall it profit thee? , Heb. added.
Sharpe arrowes of the mightie: with coales of iuniper. Or, It is as the sharpe arrowes of the mighty man with coales of iuniper.
Woe is me, that I soiourne in Mesech: that I dwell in the tents of Kedar.
My soule hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.
I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for warre. Or, a man of peace.
